comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Henry Wilson Hodge (Apr. 14, 1865 - Dec. 21, 1919) was an engineer (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=44835519) An obituary is in The sun., December 22, 1919, Page 9, column 4 "H. W. HODGE, FAMOUS ENGINEER, IS DEAD - Built Woolworth and Singer Towers and Numerous Other Steel Skyscrapers" He was the successor of Public Service Commissioner Wood, see article with photo in The sun., January 05, 1916, Page 18 (There was an inquiry into the New York City Public Service Commission, led by the State Legislative Committee resp. Senator George F. Thompson, see comments under

comment._content: Thanks for fuller name, B-59.  We'll update the record.
